revised_title: Astronomical Observations and Eclipse Studies in Lisbon
tldr: This article discusses astronomical observations made by John Chevalier in Lisbon in 1753. It includes details of the solar eclipse observed, the use of telescopes, and the measurement of the eclipse's effects. The author also mentions the observation of the satellites of Jupiter and the occultation of stars by the moon. The article highlights the differences in observations and measurements made by different astronomers at the same location.
